name: P
description:
What do I think about NFT-art in five years?
I think in 5 years crypto-art will take some new form.
It's unlikely to stop at the development of crypto, it's more likely that this story will take a step further.
Into some kind of AR where people will be able to tie art to a location or building in general, and you'll only be able to see it there.
And collectors will break out and buy walls like in the cases of Banksy's artwork.

I'm a bit confused about NFT myself. For roughly the same reasons I don't go to exhibitions, museums, etc.
I think the value of an original is high, only if that original has something in it that copies don't have. Something that will give the owner something more than the visual that can be seen from the replicas.
Like a secret cipher on the back, or a "second reading" that can be seen under certain lighting, because the original was written in special ink, let's say.

Either I'm just too tired and still haven't found the strength to try myself on the sites)
